website_summaries.verdict: A plush option with the ability to impart dry or moist heat to soothe aches away.
pros: Auto-shutoff feature for safety and convenience
cons: Users must read directions carefully, especially if using moist heat

customer_reviews.title: Control mechanism melted while in my couch - very scary.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a year ago and it worked great until the control mechanism melted. Very scary. I've tried contacting the seller but can't find any contact information for them.
customer_reviews.author: Alessa

customer_reviews.title: Updated my initial review... no longer 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: This was my first review. Only had it for a week. This is exactly what I need to help me manage my chronic back pain. However, the hand control does get really really hot. So I'm not too sure how long it will last before it either malfunctions or burns my house down. My updated review. Not yet had it for two weeks. Turned it on, went to lay on my bed then "zap". The hand controller burnt out. Burnt my bed cover. Triggered my safety switches around the house. So glad I wasn't holding the controller at the time. Don't buy this product. It's not safe. Cheap and nasty!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have had this heating pad for 2 months and it has quit working and flashing an F on the control. I have tried unplugging and plugging back in on the wall and the heating pad, still doesn't work. What a disappointment when you spend more money for what is supposed to be a good brand and it turns out to be a waste of money so no at this time I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BYP

customer_reviews.title: It was smoking and smells like melted plastic now
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for about 2 weeks. Turned it on today and after 5 minutes it started to melt the control panel. It was smoking and smells like melted plastic now. Thankful I noticed and unplugged it before a fire started!
customer_reviews.author: J Stine

customer_reviews.title: Danger! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this heating pad, which I've had for about 9 months now. That is, until the other day when I went to adjust the temperature and the controller felt hot. It was hot, because it was overheated and had melted. Normal use. No special or extraordinary conditions. I feel lucky that I noticed it and was not hurt or that a fire did not start. Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Loz1217

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: Don’t befooled by the high ratings. They’re most likely written by consumers who’ve have the item less than a year. This product malfunctions with a flashing “F” sign. If you’re willing to spend $50/ year (or less), then buy it. I was suckered into purchasing about 4 of these since they started out working so well. But they don’t last long. Never again. Please don’t buy!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Dies within a year
customer_reviews.text: Like every other Sunbeam heating pad I've bought in the past few years, it worked fine ... until it didn't. At some point, the display shows a blinking 'F' and won't turn on. Sunbeam cannot possibly be UNaware of this problem, because (a) I've found many posts by victims of the problem with previous Sunbeam heating pads and (b) there are many posts ON THE SUNBEAM SITE complainiag aboui this problem for this product. Conclusion: Sunbeam doesn't give a rat's patoot about this. BUY SOMEONE ELSE'S HEATING PADS
customer_reviews.author: J.A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Might need two!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this for myself, but turns out my sweet little kitten loves it too! It's just the right size for him and the lowest setting is perfect for keeping him cozy on those chilly fall nights. He can't get enough of this thing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS.  It is a fire hazard!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. It is a fire hazard! The auto timer did not work and it melted the housing BUT I can return it? What?
customer_reviews.author: Ann E. Rea

customer_reviews.title: Stays warm in all the settings not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I thought this with much expectation. I suffer from lower back chronic pain and I was hoping this would be a good help. Unfortunately, although this heating pad does get warm in 30 seconds it does not reach a hot enough temperature. I didn’t noticed a difference in terms of heat temperature in either the highest or lowest setting. It’s just stays warm and it didn’t bring any relief for my pain.
customer_reviews.author: Niche17

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect if you
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if you: 1. Have back problems (I have two chronic slipped disks) 2. Have arthritic cats (I have two geriatric felines) One of the first "warnings" on this product is do not use on animals. In saying that - it has an auto shut-off feature and the lowest setting is not too warm. I was just slightly surprised - it was smaller than I thought but that's my fault for not reading the dimensions. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Updated response  Sunbeam is impossible to deal with
customer_reviews.text: Update: I emailed sunbeam with my issue, it did take them a couple of weeks to respond, but they ended up replacing my heating pad. So, not a great response time but they did replace it. These work great when they work. I have had two of these and neither has lasted more than two years. Which is fine but the warranty is supposed to cover five years and sunbeam has horrible customer service. Good luck getting through to anyone. I have tried email and calling and nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with Longevity of Heating pad
customer_reviews.text: I love these heating pads but for the last 4 years they have “Failed” in less than a year. They stop working and after 2-3 returns for three different heating pads, the parent company wants to question the fact that you are returning it again. That is not in their return policy. We should let them know the problem, they replace it free of charge, & you do not have to send back the old one. Have been having trouble with getting replacements.
customer_reviews.author: RedPoetryXOTWOD

customer_reviews.title: disappointing heat output
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't heat well. Even at a setting as high as 5, it barely heats up to a temperature I expected. It is safe that way if it is to be used for a long duration but they could have provided a better temperature calibration. The high actually feels like low. I don't imagine myself using this overnight so a good amount of heat is what I expected at least from high setting but very disappointed to find it fails to do that. It also has tons of warning about not sleeping "on" it. The previous heating pad I owned didn't have this problem. I gave away mine so had to get a new one but very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Surbhi

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Sunbeam heating pads for years. Literally. Years. The heat output on them is not what it used to be. I’ve been able to use a temperature control of one and have excellent heat and excellent relief, now I have to put it up to or sometimes three. I sent the last one back thinking it was defective, but when I receive the new one it’s doing exactly the same thing. Maybe the manufacture change something because somebody complained that it got too hot. I don’t know. But I do miss the old fashion one
customer_reviews.author: Beth G

customer_reviews.title: Great heating pad
customer_reviews.text: I have an older heating pad just like this and it has worked just fine. This once here does not always want to heat up quickly or warmly enough, so I bump it up to a number 3. I then can turn it down to a one or two and it is fine. This problem does not happen every time, only once in awhile. I have never had to have it higher than a three at any time. A very good heating pad. You won't be disappointed. And you can have it stay on past the two hour minimum that so many others have.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: My family has 5 (for 2+ years)Love!!
customer_reviews.text: As parents with chronic back and shoulder pain, we have 4 of these strategically placed throughout our home and respective offices. The first one I bought (in 2015) just gave out, but all it did was start throwing an “F” and stop working. (I call that SAFE!) I am the one who uses these morning, noon, and night...couch, office chair, or bed, these are phenomenally helpful to my spine, quite warm (if you go to 5-6, for sure!), and reliable. **THERE HAS NEVER BEEN ONE INCIDENT THAT MADE ME QUESTION THE SAFETY OR INTEGRITY OF THESE HEATING PADS.** I can not recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great for back pain
customer_reviews.text: I've been using for two years and it really helps me go to sleep. I put it on the highest setting #6 when I first go to bed and then lower it to 3 or 4 before I fall asleep. You can also set it to turn off after 2 hours. My cat loves it and I turn it on the lowest setting #1 for her to sleep on it after I get out of bed in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a smaller version of this pad several years ago. It has been in such demand in the family, we decided to get another one, but larger. The 1'x2' size is excellent to get better coverage, especially on your back. It is very comfortable, and the "heat" mellow. It does get very warm, but it nicely monitors the continuing temperature. The control is always close and handy to adjust if necessary. I am a bit annoyed that the temp level is not continuously lit, and that I must touch a temperature adjustment to see the illuminated level. Of course, they probably do that so the control does not "over illuminate" your room while you're in bed.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective.
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product. The thermostat does not always work. I can put it on a low setting and it gets so hot that it's unbearable. Other times, it works ok. I've owned one before that was great. What I like about this one is that it is stitched down like a quilt and the heating pad does not become all wrinkled. There is one consistent con on both: the cord becomes detached from the heating pad too often. When that happens, you must plug it back into the heating pad, then unplug it from it's supply source and plug it back in before it will work again. Just a minor nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Varner

customer_reviews.title: The cord nd control fail in several pads within less than 20 hours of cumulative use. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 of these heating pads over the past several years. They are great until the electronics in the cord fail. I have 3 that cumulatively have less than 50 hours use 50/3=16.7 hour of useful life each.. I like the size, the feature that allows you to keep the pad on over night. I have severe pinal stenosis in my low back and neck and often used 2 pads at the same tim. I can't recommend these heating pads because they really don't last long enough to justify.
customer_reviews.author: norden weingarten

customer_reviews.title: The control is a fire hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this heating pad until it abruptly stopped working. I'd used it every day for about 6 weeks. The control became very hot, and the light just flickered when I tried to turn it on. Today I looked at some other reviews, and the control seems to be a problem with this model. I've had many heating pads in my life, and they've functioned literally for years before they simply just wore out and stopped working. This is the only time a control has been the issue. If I thought this was a fluke, I'd reorder the same pad, but after seeing the other reviews, I think the control is a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitten thanks you
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a rescue kitten that didn't have a mother cat to keep him warm. The low setting is a very subtle warmth that was just right to keep him comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Broke in just over 10 days of use on level 1! I received it on the 29th of August, today is the 10th of September. It won't turn on at all the light blinks a bit when you push the button but that's it. This is the second one I've bought because I loved the first one I had. But wow so disappointing and what a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: can be shut off without unplugging
customer_reviews.text: have had multiple sunbeam heat pads over the years. learned one can extend life of the control by turning pad off--rather than allow the auto shut-off light to continue blinking. i like sunbeam because one can turn off the control mechanism without unplugging the cord entirely. most other pads have to be unplugged. for me, life of the pad seems to be about 300-360 hours spread over 2.5-3 winters. i use pad as source of direct heat for my legs. helps limit cramps. also use to initially warm the bed on very cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: Onnalora

customer_reviews.title: Crap design!
customer_reviews.text: This pad works well when its working. Problem is the plug comes apart from the pad too easily. Easy enough just to plug back together, right? Wrong - I plug it back into pad, but it doesn't turn back on until I get up, walk over to where it's plugged into wall behind couch, remove plug from wall then plug it back into wall again. Then walk back to pad and get situated again and hope I don't move so plug won't come apart again. Every frustrating! Almost ready to return to sender. Problem is finding another this small size.
customer_reviews.author: LaRee

customer_reviews.title: Option to bypass auto-off and keep on
customer_reviews.text: Nice large heating pad. Wraps easily- not stiff. Main reason I purchased this one is that it has the option to not use auto shut off. There is still option for it if you want, but if it bugs you to have to turn your heating pad on over and over again when you notice it has cooled.. oh, it has turned itself off.. then you will like this heating pad!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry R

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes, yes.
customer_reviews.text: Wrap this bad boy around yourself! Suffering from Endometriosis pain means a heating pad becomes standard equipment. I have two of these. I’ve had many heating pads over the years. These last the longest and take quite a bit of abuse. They keep my pain down while I sleep, and get hot and stay hot. They stay on for two hours or 24 and are so great my 68y/o mom bought one for herself and her friend. They’re exceptional for back stiffness and pain. A solid investment. No crinkly plastic or hotspots. Easy clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Cameron

customer_reviews.title: this is it
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another heating pad. I got one of these a couple years ago at a thrift store, and I loved it. My hubs had a bad back and uses a heating pad to relieve it, but he got a different brand...new. One week after the bee one broke.. Well after all these other brands and sizes and whatnot...my one from the thrift store was still good. So I found the same one on here as well as an extra large and now me. Hubs, and the daughter have a heating pad. Love these. They work great, they are reliable. We will never buy others again.
customer_reviews.author: ScarletMagpie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from chronic pain and use a heating pad daily (often multiple times a day). I have purchased 6 of this specific one over the last 6 years and given them as gifts as well. Considering the usage, it is not surprising that it fails after 6 months or so. It is well worth $5/month for the relief I get. The various heating levels are effective and I appreciate the 2-hour automatic cutoff as I often fall asleep while using. I've occasionally tried another brand/cheaper model. They don't compare. If you need heat for relief, treat yourself well.
customer_reviews.author: B. S. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking trash
customer_reviews.text: Piece of trash, waste of time. If it did work, it would be great since it seems like a modern design, right material, feels good...But it doesn't work...if it can't hold the heat for more than a minute or less...It's trash, worthless. I order it three times and had to return it three time...got me a different, older and shipper design at Target, like the old one I still have since over 15 years and still works, and this one from Target, its own brand I think, works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent heating, bunches up if you lay on it
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this several times before deciding to return it. We've always preferred Sunbeam heating pads, but this 1 was a disappointment. Yes, it heated fast, but I only put it on "2" and it got really hot for a few minutes and then barely any heat. And I don't mean the "your body is used to the temp so it doesn't feel as hot" drop in temperature. Also, if I was laying on it and turned from 1 side to my other side it got all bunched up. That was not an issue with my previous Sunbeam heating pad
customer_reviews.author: Amandabrarian

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for myself and family members!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these now, for myself and family members. I keep one at the foot of my bed and use it at night to keep my feel warm. Since I've become diabetic, my feet are always cold, and this feels absolutely heavenly on my feet. I keep it at level 1 and that's all that's needed for safe, warmth and not to worry about burning my feet. I wouldn't want it any warmer at all. You must be very careful with heat on your extremities if you are diabetic because your feeling is diminished and you can't tell if something is too hot.
customer_reviews.author: code99

customer_reviews.title: Great, while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that this one didn't have a removable cover, that it had a time control option and plenty of heat settings. The only downside is after about a year it started showing an error code and after roughly a year and a half is stopped working all together. Now that I'm in the market for another one I figured I'd leave this review and although it is tempting to buy this again because it was great while it worked, I really don't want to buy a new one every year-year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Crap product
customer_reviews.text: This product is no good. I’ve bought 3 for my girlfriend. Guess I’m stupid. They work for 2 months. Then quit working ! I tried unplugging them from the pad, then plug it back in. Unplug it from the wall, then plug back in. Hold the power button for over 20 seconds to reset.... hold all the buttons to reset. It’s crap ! I want a refund !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Love the option to leave it on all night!
customer_reviews.text: Love the control that allows you to keep it on as long as you want (until you turn it off) and the two hour option. Also love the soft and flexible material of the pad. The cord is nice and long as well. The only real negative I found was it does not get as hot as the older version (I have bought several over the past 10 years). In fact I would say this one gets very warm, but not hot. The others all lasted 3-4 years before they stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ball

customer_reviews.title: This heating pad isn't reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many heating pads on Amazon. When I saw Sunbeam, I thought, "Great. A name I can trust!" I was wrong. The heat would go on and off even though the remote showed it was on the entire time. After about 5 minutes of being on, it would turn cold. Then, after a few months, it just stopped working altogether. I requested a refund through Sunbeam since they have a 5-year warranty. It is next to impossible to get in touch with Sunbeam. I messaged them on Facebook, left a comment on a post and emailed them six months ago. I just received a reply this morning. Look elsewhere if you want a reliable heating pad.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - barely lasted 1.5years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heating pad from Amazon in October 2017. It worked great until May 2019, when it stopped working and started flashing an “F” on the screen. The heating pad itself is in great shape, as I’ve taken good care of it, so no reason for it to stop working suddenly after less than 2 years of use. I contacted Sunbeam’s customer support, and after requesting that I send them pictures and proof of purchase, Sunbeam has flat-out IGNORED my request for assistance regarding their faulty product. TERRIBLE customer service by Sunbeam, and a waste of more than $30 for a product that lasted only a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyDB

customer_reviews.title: Does not get hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: We have this exact same one from a purchase on Amazon in 2015. It gets really hot, and we love it. So I ordered another one earlier in the year. It just didn’t come close to the first one. Mildly hot even at the highest setting. Figured it was defective and sent it back. Amazon replaces with another one and I just finally got around to using it (outside the return window). Same as the last one. Barely hot. I’m not sure if we are just having bad luck, or if they aren’t making these heating pads hot enough anymore for some reason. Very disappointed, and now I’m stuck with something that won’t work for us. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Kim V

customer_reviews.title: Grandma loves it
customer_reviews.text: My mom lives with us, stranded during Covid-19. Where she normally lives has a less safe environment due to grandchildren sports, etc. She has had back and muscle issues for a while and she killed our last heating pad with the constant use. Decided to upgrade, and this pad is awesome. Simple to use, super large (2x larger the old one), soft with plenty of heat. Like the easy to see large readout for older eyes. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Hesed2020

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this heating pad for a couple of years, and it has always worked fine. Today I went to plug it in, there was a loud pop and a big spark from the control panel, and it no longer works. just completely shorted out. This is a known issue that needs to be addressed by the company.
customer_reviews.author: caterpillarkiller

customer_reviews.title: Needed to be replaced after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this three weeks ago and it's already broken. The indictor screen flashes a F and the customer service rep said it means there is a fault. Sunbeam is sending me another one, but it will take a week before getting their confirmation email. It's nice that they didn't make me send back the broken one and pay for the shipping cost. The material is soft and is 12 inches x 24 inches. There are six heat levels to control the amount of heat but it doesn't get very warm at all. A hot water bottle is much warmer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Best Heating Pad Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 or 4 of these heating pads 1 for myself and the other 3 for family/friends. I can honestly say, that this is the best heating pad-1) Great size; 2) Has 6 levels of heat - and they're hot!!; 3) Never have had a problem and 4) Everyone that I have gifted with this heating pad all say that it's the best heating pad they have EVER used. You will not be disappointed and the seller is quick to respond regarding any questions or concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Wild About Books

customer_reviews.title: Stays on all night if needed. Easy to control. Safety release on the cord.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find a heating pad that will stay on all the time. This is great. Its highest setting is still quite hot without being the boil-water temp that my old one was on high. The cord disconnects from the pad if too much tension is put on it, which is a great safety feature. I woke up wrapped in the pad, but the cord was not wrapped around me too. If it disconnects, a code flashes on the screen. You will need to unplug it from the outlet before you plug it back into the pad for it to function again.
customer_reviews.author: Annazon

customer_reviews.title: Third times not the charm.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift and it worked twice. It did heat quickly but after the second use the unit failed to turn on. No lights or anything. Allowed the unit to sit unplugged for 24 hours and attempted to use it again and nothing. power indicator light will not even turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This heating pad does not get nearly hot enough. It arrived on July 22 and now won't work. I went Sunbeam an email requesting a new one and sent them all the pictures they requested and I have heard nothing. Zero. Nada. I'm so angry. I will not buy another one. The Walgreens heating pads cost way less and last longer. Totally disappointed. No one makes anything to last and then the warranty means nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Tsunamismommy

customer_reviews.title: Large, even heating and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Size is fantastic, large enough to cover my whole lower back and thensome. Its very soft, the side with the fluff seems like it diffuses the heat more so you can use the opposite side for more direct heat. The pad itself is flexible and doesn't make crinkly plastic noises like some others or feel like the heating element will break. Temperature control is simple and easy, cord is long, burgundy color is accurate to the image - it's a good heating pad.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana

customer_reviews.title: Great for after surgery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a surgery, and I am very glad I did. It is light, so it did not apply any pressure to my wounds, it's portable, easy to operate, and very soft. My only complaint is the changes in temperature with no adjustments. I deducted 1 star for that. Most of the time the heat number is accurate, however, sometimes it gets very hot on a lower setting, and then gets very cool on a higher setting. Other than that, I love it, and would definitely recommend it. Fyi... It's not the best for neck use, but so far, I have found it works well on the shoulders, stomach, legs, back and any flat surface on the body.
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for back pain
customer_reviews.text: I wear out heating pads in eight months as I have kyphosis of the spine and lots of tight muscles in my back although it’s not recommended I do sleep on it in order to get a good nights sleep these heating pads are a great quality and last a long time with lots of use I will continue to buy these every eight months as it seems that’s about how long they last use them every night for 8 to 10 hours a night
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fitts

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these heating pads. They get hot quick and ypu can control the amount of heat you'd like to have. Unfortunately mine only lasted a little over a year. I bought it in February of 2019 and it's March 2020 and I woke up to a hot controller with no power tip light turn on. It was plugged in all night but off and it seems to have burned up internally with evidence of heat in there box but no power available to turn on. I've tied several outlets. :(
customer_reviews.author: CManahan

customer_reviews.title: wonderful having options for duration of heat
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. A must have for this family. I always purchase "back up" pads for emergency need for other family members. Eventually stopped working, but that takes years of daily use. We have 4 rooms with pads, so that we do not have move them to fit current need. The safety mechanism of having cord separate from pad prevents damage with pulling. You just have to know that it will have a code flashing--requires unplugged, then cord reattached before plugging into socket
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy but not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic myofascial pain in my neck/head/shoulders/back and need my heating pads to get HOT. Even on the highest setting (and when I lay on it to trap the heat) this doesn't get anywhere near hot enough. It is very soft however and nice for laying on top of me at lower heat setting to keep warm. It also helps with minor aches and pains like cramps and the achy tendon in my arm. So it's kind of nice and not totally useless, but go for something else if you're looking for serious pain/tension relief.
customer_reviews.author: Tezi

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: I received this heating pad from Amazon on April 26, 2019. I wanted to replace my 10 year old heating pad which is smaller and showing it's age. For past 6 months I had been using it nightly for my chronic back and right heat pain. I had discovered that sleeping on low heat helps ease my night time right hip and right lower extremity pain. But after 4 nights of use it stopped working showing "F" on the dial. I unplugged it from the wall and left it unplugged over night. Still not working. So I am back to Old Faithful Heating Pad. VERY UNHAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: BeBe

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: After two back surgeries, I have a heating pad in every chair I sit in. However, the older ones would bunch up within the cloth sleeve and I would have to straighten them out. What a hassle! I bought this from the reviews & remarks. So glad that I did! It is all "one" unit, so no hassles of the heating element separating from the sleeve. It is big enough to reach around to my sides. It has (6) settings I believe, however, I can never go past number 2. Definitely warm enough for me! It also has an auto shut off which I truly like. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE - BARELY GETS LUKE WARM AND IS NON RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this heating pad based on customer reviews and am perplexed by the high ratings. I bought this for my husband since he is having neck and back pain. We just used it once and are extremely dissatisfied. At the highest temperature rating, it's barely warm and doesn't do anything for pain alleviation. I understand that heating pads have controls built into them so that they won't burn you, but this is ridiculous. It should get moderately warm at the very least, but it was luke warm at best. I tried to return this item and was told that it's non-returnable, which is really disappointing. Save your money and go with another heating pad. This one is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd sunbeam heatingpad the first 2 lasted about 2 yrs and recently started flashing the F like you can see in other pictures. So I ordered this one, I used it less than a week when it happened. The pad was on 1 but my back was getting super hot!! I grabbed the controller I heard a pop, saw a quick white flash and some smoke. I am so happy it happened with me not the times I left it for my poor old cat!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel 9

customer_reviews.title: Purchased two and each broke
customer_reviews.text: I think this works great--when it works. I purchased one in 2015, that worked great until May 2019. Then, it broke. I purchased a replacement, and this one just broke, not 4 months later. The control buttons box mechanism seems to be faulty and stops working, yet the box itself gets extremely hot (fire hazard?). I have reached out to the company for assistance.
customer_reviews.author: pie

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in ~2016, used heavily, still working great!
customer_reviews.text: Gets use for at least 5 days a month. Sometimes in the winter just to preheat a bed (i mean, it's a nice perk to having one, not purchased for that reason.) Don't know what the manufacturing quality is today, but I've had this for around 4 years and it's been bumped around plenty to break. Still works great. to be honest, settings 2 and 3 are fairly warm. never really use the higher heat settings.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: Too hot on lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: I like that this pad was smaller and it does the job but out of 6 heat settings, the lowest is almost intolerable. I can’t imagine needing the other 5 as they get hotter. I love the controller being backlit and it’s nice to have the choice of auto shut off or stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many a heating pad over the years! This one is fantastic (bought it for my mom and sister and they love it too!)! It is easy to use, big numbers, heats up instantly, cools down instantly and is super soft! It’s large enough to heat a large area of a leg, back, shoulder. The green color is Not as pictured... it’s more of a forest green. The wires are a little cumbersome when packing... But I love this pad the Best!! Can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: paris mcvickar

customer_reviews.title: Best heating pad on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Best heating pad on the market.I’ve used this brand over the years and found they seem to last forever. I purchased two more for different rooms in the house so we don’t have to pick them up and move them. Are use this for both leg cramp or shoulder pain relief as well as laying it across my stomach if I have any stomach issues like gas. The product is easy to mold to my body and heats up very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Heats up
customer_reviews.text: I like this one because it stays on or 2 hour shut off. It puts out great amount of heat. Ive purchased several of these and i found this brand the best BUT it has to be the green XL not the burgundy colored XL. I know it sounds weird and should make no difference but in my experience it did. I have 2 greens and they produce a great equal amount of heat.
customer_reviews.author: cyn mcgrath N.

customer_reviews.title: just doesn't get warm enough
customer_reviews.text: i have larger sunbeam heating pads that set on 5, will be quite hot, enough to really dull the pain...this one set on a 6, feels barely warm. Not sure if I got a bad one or that is how it is supposed to be. Also i think the velcro straps are very difficult to wrap and hold at the same time; took me awhile to get it on, Some short velcro tabs would make much more sense!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Best heating pad I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I use this heating pad ALL the time! I love that it has the option for the automatic cut off after 2 hours or to stay on continuously. A lot of times I’ll fall asleep with it on my back. It has never burned me and the outside is sooo soft. I have been through a lot of the other heating pads from Walmart and none of them compare to this one. I love it!!! I also love that it’s larger. It covers a good bit of my whole back
customer_reviews.author: W.Clark

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased sunbeam heating pads, no other brands compare to the amount of heat/relief these provide. Unfortunately, I have purchased four in less than a year and all have stopped working. I have endometriosis and heating pads help me tremendously, but sunbeam's quality has gone away. Please go back to the quality you once had.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Remains soft and pliable warm or "off"
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the heating pad with the cheap flannel cover that got stiff and hard when it cooled. The plastic snap was unreliable. So I tried this one and it solved all those problems. The cover is integrated and never gets stiff or wrinkled. I will buy again. The only drawback is the digital controls are hard to read (for me). The click is also loud so may disturb your sleeping partner if you use during the night. Overall I think it is an improvement over the typical heating pads on the market.
customer_reviews.author: EDH shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Heating Pads, but Not So Durable
customer_reviews.text: My wife and daughter love these things. I do not use them. I have bought a few already. The one negative is that they don't seem to last a long time. 2 or 3 of them have already gone bad. I think the ones that have gone bad have lasted maybe a year of two. But some of them last longer. That is about the only negative, but it is a substantial negative in my opinion. But as long as my wife and daughter use them, we will stick with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bumppo

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this heating pad! It is larger than any I have had before, and I love the settings. For me, I usually keep it at 1 or 2 if my back is killing me, but it goes up to 6 which would catch me on fire! Only kidding! But it also has a setting you can push for either 2 hrs or indefinately. I have two which I use for my upper back and one for lower back/hips. The material is soft and plushy which I love, so you don't have to deal with the plastic ones with chintzy material you have to constantly move around. They are definately worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: I really like this heating pad but the last one only lasted ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this heating pad but the last one only lasted a few months. Hopefully this one will stay around longer. Update, this one lasted a few weeks, After reading the more current reviews I think there may be a batch issue. The detachable cord in my opinion is a bad design and this one does not stay connected. This means every time I move I get the dreaded flashing F which means I have to unplug the cord from the outlet, re insert the connector completely into the pad then re-plug into the outlet. It's great while it works but I am completely disappointed and on the hunt for something more reliaable.
customer_reviews.author: Instantkarma

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After using less than 10 times this will not heat up any more. My return window has closed and I cannot return or exchange it. It is flashing "F" and will not turn on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ADORE THIS PAD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pad for over 2 years now and I'm ordering another just in case anything ever happens to it. I use it daily, I use it for hours, I use it for a nerve pain condition, I use it for muscle aches, I use it for arthritis pain. The thought of going back to a "normal" pad is unthinkable. I thought it was a remarkable pad when I first used it. I still think so. I've never had a minute's problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these and it worked so well for a long time. My guess is that the manufacturing changed or the components because the one I just received is awful. It constantly comes unplugged as it is not snug like it won't 'stay together' so I taped it together. The heat is not as good as the prior version, it does not get as hot, and it does not maintain heat. Again, I had the same product previously and it was great. Looks like the manufacturer cut some corners so I would not recommend this product. I'll toss it and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly 6 settings auto off option
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for two days. Works well so far. Happy. 1. Large size covers all the way around to the hip joints 2. Heats up quickly 3. Thick cloth covering allows it to be directly on the skin without overheating or burning. 4. Use spray mist bottle not a cloth and do not over wet. Feels like the heat isn't coming through when not on the skin at first, it must be put on the skin to feel the heat. 5. Auto off option nice feature. Can be set to auto off in 2 hours or leave on indefinitely 6. Extra long cord
customer_reviews.author: gunny colvin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped After A Few Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Sunbeam heating pad that had lasted about 1 year. I would have been okay with this lasting the same length of time. I was surprised that this didn't even last 4 months. Very disappointed. Would not recommend. I also had an issue with the cord disconnecting continually. I'll seek a different brand to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't warm up, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heating pad, with an optional 2 hr on or stay on continuously option, for heat therapy with pain. The heat control goes from 1-6 but there is minimal difference in the heat. I would expect 6 to be hot or at least very warm. I have other Sunbeam heating pads which last 1-2 hours but they have 4 heat settings and get much warmer than this one, (even on the lower settings). I have been searching over 8 years for a stay on heating pad. Disappointed in this product. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bonchel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sunbeam products have consistently let me down. I purchased this hesting pad for post surgery relief. Upon plugging the product into the wall, it began to heat up quickly. Then about 3 minutes later it shut off. I tried several outlets in my home, no luck. After about an hour you can turn it back on, but again it only last a few minutes before it shuts off again. I went thru this process sever times. I will be retur ing this trash. Better go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: jacob Spragg

customer_reviews.title: Not as hot as it used to be  brand nnw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item about 4 months ago and I loved it soo soo much. But then I got the F Code and it was dead.. I ordered the new unit and it only heats up to about half the temperature that the same exact pad I got last time does. I am disappointed that they changed the temperature Update: 4-25-17 Had the unit about 6 months and it gets a F on the display and will not work. This is the second unit i bought and the same issue. These units only last a few months and for the price i believe they should last longer. Unfourtantly i will not buy sunbeam again
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the small size. Couldn't others in this size or smaller. The size is great, if it worked. The bottom corner where the connection for the plug heats up; however, the small section only heats for roughly 5 minutes and cools back down like it isn't on. The rest of the heating pad is cool to the touch. I am so disappointed in this product. I had high hopes for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki DiNardi

customer_reviews.title: Not XL
customer_reviews.text: It is small and the cord was so uncomfortable because of placement it hurt to lay on. I have used sunbeam for years but sadly no more. I need a heating pad for back pain and this is too small and the cord gives me more pain :/ It did arrive on time but I did return it for something larger {that actually covered the back} and with better cord placement. The old sunbeam was definitely better {larger and cord was not painful}. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: On 3rd unit.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought lasted 3 years. The second one has lasted less than a year. I use this product almost every night. I’m careful not to bend it over and I keep the cord plugged into the wall and not extension cords, so as to avoid increased fire danger. Never had a unit melt. But these things aren’t extremely durable. Growing up we had one that lasted over 10 years. Don’t know what happened that changed with the quality. I still buy these as they heat up well and the construction seems overall not too cheap. I haven’t tried sending back my units which have failed yet but they do appear to come with a good warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Meat

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this heating pad in the last 2 hours.So far I'm very happy with it. I'm in the bed getting over being sick and my backs a little achy and I'm a little gasy (sorry) and this has already helped tremendously...seems the heating is eveningly spread across the pad...I like the controls with heating 1, 2, up or down...control of whether it auto cuts off in 2 hours or stays on. I have the olive/tan color and it's nice also...it's really soft which is another plus! Says it machine washable too!! .😀 That's the controls laying on my blanket so you can see them...🤗
customer_reviews.author: JustBrenna

customer_reviews.title: A Heating Pad that is Large Enough & Stays on Without Turning Itself Off!!
customer_reviews.text: Sunbeam is a name we can all rely on. They have many different models of heating pads. The 2 primary benefits of this particular heating pad is (1) that it covers your entire back and (2) it has a control that allows you to have the heat on for either 2 hours or continuously for as long as you want. The feature of continuous heat is hard to find. Most heating pads are designed to turn off every 2 hours. I highly recommend this particular heating pad.
customer_reviews.author: manoit

customer_reviews.title: Worst!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST heating pad EVER! I’ve had it for a year now, and every time it comes undone. The cord from the pad. The cord is not fixed to the heating pad. The cord plugs in at the side of the heating pad. ...every time you shift your weight it comes undone! Then you have to get rid of the error message. Replug it in at the pad; then unplugged it from the outlet!! Forcing you to unplug it from the outlet and restart it is Stupid. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Carter

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this one!!! Great Rip-off!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very comfortable, and size is just right. Enough room for me, and my Tea Cup Yorkie. :) It heats up really fast, and puts out a lot of heat. I used to keep my old one on #5 setting, but with this one I never have to go past #2. Ok, this is May 5, 2017, and I have to change my review. The above statement was correct, from the end of Feb. to the second week of April!! Then the heating pad started flashing "F," and NOTHING I have done will get it to work. If I pay $40 for a heating pad, I expect it to get more than 6 weeks operation from it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bonnie Serrett

customer_reviews.title: Great heating pad..while it lasts!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great heating pad for muscle strain and arthritis pain...while it functions!! I have purchased a total of 7 of these over the past few years for myself and gifts. Unfortunately, after about 6-9 months of use, they stop heating and display shows "F" code! Plus only one I could find that allows you to leave on longer than 2 hours. So was helpful while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: lisaccrn89

customer_reviews.title: Love  the Heat, Always On option but Disconnects Alot
customer_reviews.text: picked for my husband with back & neck pain. His previous heating pad stopped getting hot and kept turning off. I looked for a dependable heating pad that had an option to override the auto shutoff & got hot. This pad does but easily disconnects from the power cord. He uses the pad in his recliner. He gave his previous pad to a little semi-feral Cat that visits our front porch every day.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best heat pad ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heat pad, it puts out so much heat, I start at the highest setting, which is 6, but have to lower it to 5 or 4 after a while. Fortunately, I haven't had any of the issues others have mentioned, the control doesn't heat up at all. I've been doing castor oil packs and using it on its own several times a day, it amounts to 2 or 2.5 hrs a day and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, compact and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't quite sure whether to order this or the XL but this one is perfect. It's wide enough for my back, shoulder to shoulder, but not too huge - the XL would have been way too big when I just wanted something to put under a sore back. The material is soft and flexible, the pad heats up surprisingly quickly - almost instantly - and it shuts off conveniently. I use the #2 heat setting, might maybe use #3, but certainly can't imagine needing anything hotter than that, it's toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: BlytheTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: heat is a little weird.....
customer_reviews.text: sometimes turning it on and up is fine. other times the levels seem to be messed up. it gets super hot and then cools off. and then i have to turn it down and back up to get the level right. it can be frustrating cause i dont wanna get burned cause the levels and heat are being weird. the heat is good when its working right. size is awesome, color is great. and feel is great. love the auto-off feature at night and other times. just some heat changing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 star, disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: When there is heat output, it works great! However, my heat goes in and out VERY often. Most times I can't even use it because even if it's on it wont heat. Very disappointed after reading good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Best heating pad I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This heating pad has a setting where you have it on as long as you like - so be careful not to use it for too long. I am purchasing another just because it is so handy to have. Cord is quite long for reaching farther areas as is the cord for the controller. You can use this for dry or moist heat. Is wide enough to cover most of the lower back and I also use it to wrap around my entire knee and calf. Super soft and comfy. Does not smell when on. And - hottest setting is super hot and can burn your skin.
customer_reviews.author: WhimsicalDiya

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Had it for month and a half. Quit working after 4 1/2 weeks. Can’t return it. Warning, don’t buy this product or You will be stuck with a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: VVet69

customer_reviews.title: The inside plastic part would constantly bunch up and was very hard to straighten out so I ordered this heating pad instead and
customer_reviews.text: I am a young woman dealing with both a multiples-pregnancy and a disability that causes back and leg pain. My old heating pad was hard plastic with a thin fleece removable cover. The inside plastic part would constantly bunch up and was very hard to straighten out so I ordered this heating pad instead and I am SO glad I did. It is SO soft, does not bunch up, heats up very high but has lots of options for different heat settings. I love that it has the option of auto-off OR continuous heat. It is large enough that it covers my whole lower back at once from hip to hip. This was an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Brooks

customer_reviews.title: love/hate this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product, but it does not last. This is my 2nd heating pad over last couple years of the exact same one. After using it for few months, it started to shows 'F', indicating malfunction on the display and it no longer turns on. I did not think of the warranty nor thought too much into it, so I ended up throwing it away the 1st time I purchased. I got same error message on my 2nd hearing pad now after using it of only several months. Trying to get hold of Sunbeam mfg, but have not got response back yet.
customer_reviews.author: ram

customer_reviews.title: Nice heating pad
customer_reviews.text: Really nice heating pad. The size is big enough to go all the way across my lower back so I don't have to move it around. Heats up nice and hot. Only thing is if you use timer it starts blinking and you have to unplug it to reset it. Not a big deal but I'd feel better if it shut off completely. The heat does shut down with timer though. Be sure to use timer if you might fall asleep because it gets very hot and will burn you if left on.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Smoot-Chesley

customer_reviews.title: Good Heating Pad but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several of these for multiple Surgery recoveries over the last couple of years. Heats up quick and I like that you can shutoff the Auto Off which keeps heating pad on for as long as you like. Plush side of Heating Pad is very soft, like crushed velvet. I have had to return a couple that after a month or 2 they would not work and an error message would occur on the display. Unplugging and plugging back in did not fix. Returns/Refund for them were easy through Amazon. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Renne Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ordered green, got dark grey
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived, I was very disappointed with the color, which is dark grey, rather than the bright green that I ordered. I had previously ordered this same heating pad in the green and that one compared with the advertised picture. This one does not and instead is a very drab dark gray. However, if there are no problems with the heating element I will keep it. Not a happy customer though.
customer_reviews.author: snowflake

customer_reviews.title: Heating pad gone wild.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these plush heating pads. I have had extensive back surgrey on my back as a child and now getting spinal stenosis in my spine from that...I have had this since 2017 and now (2019) it is already quiting on me. I have to unplug and plug it back in to get the F to stop flashing. This is the only gripe I have. If it didn't cost so much I would have given a 4 star, but with it quitting I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: kyspirit

customer_reviews.title: I want to like this believe me I do!
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this heating pad I really do. But Sunbeam makes it really difficult. I’ve only had this three months and it stopped working this morning. It’s predictable because that’s how long all my other heating pads from this company have lasted. I wish I could get something that lasted a few years not a couple months. When it’s working I love the pad. Large enough for trouble areas and the heat settings are great. I love the auto off feature! Sadly I’ll have to go somewhere else for my next heating pad however. This is at least my sixth product from them that has bit the dust within months of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Winter using this heating pad. I never go as high as the "8" setting. The "4" setting is quite warm. Maybe the problem other people had with the overheating control was because they put it on the highest settings?? (Advice: Neve drive a car 120 mph, never use a washing machine on the heaviest load, never use heating pads on the highest settings, etc. etc.)
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN WALKER

product_meta.title: Sunbeam 002014-915-000 Xpressheat Heating Pad, Garnet Red, 12 x 15 inches
product_meta.description: Color:Garnet Red| Size:12 x 15 InchWASHING INSTRUCTIONS : DO NOT DRY CLEAN , DO NOT BLEACH! DO NOT USE WRINGER FOR DETACHABLE PAD , 1. Disconnect pad from outlet.2. Detach Pad Connector from the Control Connector. 3. Wash by hand or as follows in an automatic washer using slow agitation and normal spin speed: Fill washer with warm water. Add minimum amount of all purpose detergent, agitate to dissolve, measure heating pad before washing. Add heating pad and soak five minutes. Agitate two minutes. Spin. Fill for cool rinse, agitate one minute then spin. Dry in automatic dryer on high heat, five minutes only, or line dry. Remove damp heating pad from dryer, block to original size, and drape to finish drying. Do not iron your heating pad. 4. Do not plug in pad and pad connector until they are completely dry.
feature_bullets: The electric heating pad features XpressHeat technology that heats up the pad in 30 seconds, to soothe away tension and pain fast; moist heat option for deep therapeutic relief
Heat pad has a digital LED controller that helps you easily switch between 6 personalized heat settings to achieve the perfect comfort level
Easy care, machine washable soft microplush fabric offers maximum comfort for daily use
Includes sponge so it can be used with moist or dry heat

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
